resource.chars:
From these observed facts Mr Rainey concludes 
that the minute particles in the capillaries are 
“germinating particles” (whence derived does 
not seem to be clear) and that they make 
their way out of the capillaries (p30) enter 
the primary fasciculi and there give rise to 
the “vermiform” bodies - which then penetrate 
the sarcolemma (p16) and become encysted 
with <s>[text?]<\s> connective tissue - The Encysted 
body developes a head & neck and becomes 
a Cysticercus -
Without being in any way disposed 
to question the accuracy of Mr Raineys observations 
I cannot recommend that his paper should 
be published in the Philosophical Transactions 
in the first place because the facts do not 
appear to me to bear out the conclusions;
and secondly, on account of the almost total 
absence of that reference to what has 
already been done - without which I 
conceive that no paper should be published 
anywhere - least of all in the Philosophical 
Transactions -
